data.text: @SharonAnnHyman @JeffCavanagh1 @Aaron_Derfel There's some of that but (anecdotally) many people I know still want boosters but can't get them until 3 months post infection.

@SharonAnnHyman @JeffCavanagh1 @Aaron_Derfel Though a lot of people I know who got Omicron had already had a booster, that fact is probably also making some people less aware that boosters still help. Messaging around vaccines in Qc has been terrible, very paternalistic and not nearly transparent enough.
@fifilamoura @JeffCavanagh1 @Aaron_Derfel Yes for sure. But I really think many of those  think they don’t need boosters now, the information is so unclear.

@SharonAnnHyman @JeffCavanagh1 @Aaron_Derfel I'm pretty sure another reason why less people are going for boosters is a lot of people were infected with Omicron, because we didn't roll out boosters early enough, so they all now have to wait three months to get a booster.
@JeffCavanagh1 @fifilamoura @Aaron_Derfel And it’s confusing, I think most people think boosters are only for the elders.
@Aaron_Derfel Love NZ, had the opportunity to immigrate there years ago.  One of my big what ifs....
@va2lam @_Imogenius @Aaron_Derfel Are you guys for real? 'We might also see some child deaths due to Omicron.' Way to fearmonger....
@Aaron_Derfel Give is all a better picture of this....What is that as a percentage? Cases to the population? The public really wants to know...

@Aaron_Derfel Maybe its a cultural thing in HK. HK lowest vax rates are kids and seniors. Who cares for HK kids as parents work? Their grandparents. Kids spread to kids who bring it home to grandparents. Seniors in Asian culture more likely to live with families than in seniors homes.
